Content: No company is visiting to hire Data Scientist/ML Engineer in my college.From July 15th, the placement season started and more than 15 companies had their Online Assessment but no company is hiring for Data Science roles and I did only Data Science courses.This is Day 2 of hashtaghashtag#CampusStories where we decode the stories from this Placement Season.Everyone is talking about AI/ML and how GenAI will change the landscape, its correct but why no companies are hiring for Data Science roles in my college. Content: Should you hire a friend or relative in your company? I‚Äôd NEVER do that. I say this as someone who learned it the hard way.There‚Äôs always this unsaid rule, ‚ÄúGive them a chance, they‚Äôre your own.‚ÄùBut here‚Äôs what no one tells you:Your company is not your family‚Äôs charity project.It‚Äôs your vision.Your risk.Your sleepless nights.Your blood, sweat, and balance sheet.And when you hire someone just because you know them; not because they deserve the seat, you compromise everything you‚Äôve built.I once hired someone I trusted personally. Because I thought:‚ÄúLet me help them.‚Äù‚ÄúThey‚Äôll understand me better.‚Äù‚ÄúIt‚Äôll be easy to work with someone I already trust.‚ÄùI couldn‚Äôt have been more wrong.Here‚Äôs what actually happened:‚Üí Expected special treatment.‚Üí Took feedback personally.‚Üí Missed deadlines without guilt.‚Üí And assumed I owed them flexibility just because of our personal bond.The worst part?I couldn‚Äôt even call them out the way I‚Äôd call any other employees.Because, ‚ÄúGharwale kya kahenge?‚ÄùAnd family dinners got awkward real quick. You can‚Äôt fire a cousin easily.You can‚Äôt challenge a best friend without creating rifts.And you definitely can‚Äôt build a high-performance culture when one team member thinks they are special and the rules don‚Äôt apply to them.If you‚Äôre a first-generation entrepreneur like me, you already fight too many battles.Don‚Äôt make emotional baggage one of them.It‚Äôs hard, I know.Instead:‚Üí Hire for skill.‚Üí Train like they owe you results, not favors.‚Üí And keep your inner circle sacred‚Äîbut out of payroll.Hire people who earn the seat.Not people you‚Äôre emotionally obligated to give it to.Build a company where relationships are earned through performance, not birthright.That‚Äôs how you protect your dream.So here‚Äôs my rule now:Help friends outside the company.Build with professionals inside it.What‚Äôs your take?hashtag#founders hashtag#startups hashtag#entrepreneurship hashtag#relationships hashtag#workculture

Content: Welcome to LinkedIn 2025: The Algorithm has Changed!Now you could get a Million impressions, without even posting!Here‚Äôs the secret: comment.The algorithm is no longer rewarding creators for just showing up.It‚Äôs rewarding how you show up.And this month, everything changed again.‚û°Ô∏è The July 2025 LinkedIn Algorithm Update: 6 Game-Changing Shifts: 1. The Feed Now Recycles Posts From 2‚Äì3 Weeks Ago‚Üí LinkedIn‚Äôs pushing posts that still generate dwell time or profile clicks‚Üí This extends the life cycle of content and increases ROI on quality postsPost less often, but more intentionally. Let your good posts work longer.3. ‚ÄúFollow First‚Äù is Replacing ‚ÄúConnect‚ÄùNew users are now set to follow creators by default ‚Üí Your audience is expanding quietly, not loudly‚Üí More visibility, less engagement, more silent influenceWrite for the silent 90%, people who never comment, but watch everything.4. ‚ÄúValue Per Viewer‚Äù Is the New CurrencyLinkedIn is no longer rewarding vanity metrics‚Üí It tracks: dwell time, saves, profile clicks, and how your post fits viewer intent‚Üí Posts that ‚Äúsound viral‚Äù but feel hollow are tankingFocus on resonance > reach. Content: Following IBM‚Äôs earnings announcement earlier today, I had a lot of conversation and without fail, DeepSeek came up. It‚Äôs clear this moment is resonating across the industry, so I wanted to share a few thoughts directly here.For too long, the AI race has been a game of scale where bigger models meant better outcomes. But there is no law of physics that dictates AI models must remain big and expensive. The cost of training and inference is just another technology challenge to be solved. We‚Äôve seen this play out before. In the early days of computing, storage and processing power were prohibitively expensive. Yet, through technological advancements and economies of scale, these costs plummeted. AI will follow the same path.At IBM, we‚Äôve been on this journey for years. We‚Äôve been steadfast in our belief that efficient, fit-for-purpose models can deliver exceptional value and that open is key to innovation. Our work has already led to up to 30-fold reductions in inference costs.This is promising for businesses. Technology becomes truly transformative when it becomes more affordable. As more companies embrace this shift, we‚Äôll see an AI landscape that is both more powerful and accessible.
